messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name:  I will derive this data from the following paragraph: CASE NAME: Midnight Opal Heist DATE: 12/04/44  The city's famous jewelry store, Luminous Gems, was robbed last night. The thieves took an invaluable opal necklace known as the Midnight Opal. CCTV footage reveals at least four suspects involved, who used a mix of technology and sleight of hand to bypass security systems.  LAW ENFORCEMENT ENGAGEMENT:  JEWELRY CRIME LEAD: Captain R. L. Stevens is overseeing the entire operation to recover the stolen necklace and capture the thieves. FORENSICS: Detectives M. N. Diaz and O. P. Fisher are processing the crime scene, focusing on fingerprints and other forensic evidence. TECH EXPERT: Detective Q. R. Gomez specializes in electronic security systems and is trying to understand how the thieves bypassed the alarms. UNDERCOVER: Detectives S. T. Huang and U. V. Ingram are trying to trace the necklace in the black market, disguising themselves as potential buyers. PATROL: Patrol Officers W. X. Jackson, Y. Z. Kelly, and A. B. Lee have increased their rounds in the area, looking out for any suspicious activity or individuals. COMMUNITY LIAISON: Lieutenant C. D. Martin is engaging with local pawn shops, jewelry traders, and the general public for tips or leads. ADDITIONAL DETAILS:  An anonymous tip mentioned the involvement of an international jewelry thief known only as The Phantom, who has been linked to several high-profile thefts worldwide.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.
